name: Anne Rosenzweig's Baked Apples
recipeIngredient: 6 large Rome apples, cored and peeled
2 Granny Smith apples, peeled and cored

recipeInstructions.text: For the Rome apples, preheat the oven to 375 degrees. Place the apples in a baking dish. Combine the brown sugar and cinnamon and stuff in the apple cavities. Mix cider with grenadine and drizzle over the apples. Bake until tender, about 1 hour, basting every 5 minutes. Cool to room temperature.
For the syrup, dice the Granny Smith apples into 1/4-inch cubes. Over medium-high heat, cook sugar and cider until sugar is caramelized, about 30 minutes.
Add rum and applejack and cook 1 minute. Remove from the heat and stir in the diced apples. Ladle the warm syrup over the baked apples. Top with vanilla ice cream. Serve.
